metadata.title: CVE-2019-19728 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
SchedMD Slurm before 18.08.9 and 19.x before 19.05.5 executes srun --uidwith incorrect privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 19.05.5-1
libpam-slurm-adopt - 19.05.5-1
libpmi0 - 19.05.5-1
libpmi2-0 - 19.05.5-1
libslurm-perl - 19.05.5-1
libslurm34 - 19.05.5-1
libslurmdb-perl - 19.05.5-1
slurm-client - 19.05.5-1
slurm-client-emulator - 19.05.5-1
slurm-wlm - 19.05.5-1
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 19.05.5-1
slurm-wlm-emulator - 19.05.5-1
slurm-wlm-torque - 19.05.5-1
slurmctld - 19.05.5-1
slurmd - 19.05.5-1
slurmdbd - 19.05.5-1
sview - 19.05.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '19.05.5-1').
